newsBanner.title: How to Connect Landa Online Accounting to the Tax System
newsBanner.description: Steps to connect and send invoices to the Taxpayers System
newsBanner.question: Can one user manage more than one business?
newsBanner.answer: Yes. Each user can create and manage multiple businesses with separate plans. Business owners can access all their companies with one login. They can also invite other users by email, and invited users can log in with their own email.

page.card-message: Click on a business name to enter

guide.slide1: Welcome to Landa. We hope you enjoy working with it. Let’s go through a quick guide.
guide.slide2: Click your business name to enter it.
guide.slide3: For more options like deleting a business or adding a new user, use this menu.
guide.slide4: This icon shows you are the owner/creator of the business. Owners can delete, renew, and add users.
guide.slide5: Use this option to renew your plan (buy subscription).
guide.slide6: For tutorials, visit the Knowledge Base on our website.

labels.ratios_net_margin_info:
Net profit margin
Calculated by dividing net income (profit) by net sales. This ratio shows what percentage of sales is net profit. A limitation of this ratio is that many costs, such as financing costs included in net income, are not related to sales activity but appear in the ratio. Changes in this ratio are influenced by sales volume, pricing strategy, and cost structure. The higher this ratio, the better.
labels.ratios_debt_ratio_info:
Debt Ratio
Shows what percentage of assets is financed by liabilities (Assets = Liabilities + Equity). The higher this ratio, the higher the company's profitability, provided that the return on assets exceeds the cost of debt. This ratio also indicates the company's ability to withstand reductions in net assets due to losses without endangering creditors. Acceptable values depend on the historical stability of profitability; more stable profits allow creditors and investors to tolerate higher ratios.
labels.ratios_current_ratio_info:
Current Ratio
Calculated by dividing current assets by current liabilities. Current assets are assets that can be quickly and easily converted into cash, while current liabilities are those due within a year. A higher current ratio may indicate better liquidity. A ratio greater than 2 is desirable, and major lenders like banks tend to view such businesses favorably.
labels.ratios_dso_info:
Days Sales Outstanding
Indicates the number of days it takes for the company to collect its receivables. A lower DSO is generally better, meaning receivables are collected faster. However, a too-low DSO may indicate overly strict credit policies, which could harm business.

taxApiInvoiceType.posOnline: Type 3: Sale via Online Portal / POS

newsBanner.title: Guide to Connecting Landa Online Accounting to Taxpayer System
newsBanner.description: How to connect to the taxpayer system and send your invoices to it
newsBanner.question: Can a user have more than one business?
newsBanner.answer: Yes. Each user can create multiple businesses with separate subscriptions and plans. Someone who owns several companies can access all their businesses with one username. The business owner can also invite other users via email. Invited users can access the business with their own email.

accountReview.tip: Double-click on the desired row to see its transactions in the subsequent tabs

balanceSheet.tipMessage: The financial status of any business, small or large, is evaluated based on the two main components of the balance sheet: assets and liabilities. Owners’ equity is the third section. The accounting equation shows how these three important components are related. This equation is also known as the fundamental accounting equation or balance sheet equation.
